title: Relates to determinations by county canvassing boards
summary: Relates to determinations by county canvassing boards.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1445

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MILLMAN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Election Law

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to determinations by coun-
         ty canvassing boards

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivisions 2 and 3 of section 9-212 of the election law,
    2  as amended by chapter 635 of the laws of 1990, are amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    2.  All  such  determinations  shall  be  in writing and signed by the
    5  members of the canvassing board or a majority  of  them  and  filed  and
    6  recorded in the office of the board of elections. [Except in the city of
    7  New  York  and  in  the  counties of Nassau, Orange and Westchester, the
    8  board of elections shall cause a copy of such determinations, and of the
    9  statements filed in its  office  upon  which  such  determinations  were
   10  based,  to  be  published  once  in each of the newspapers designated to
   11  publish election notices and the  official  canvass.  The  statement  of
   12  canvass  to  be  published, however, shall not give the vote by election
   13  districts but shall contain only the total vote for  a  person,  or  the
   14  total vote for and the total vote against a ballot proposal, cast within
   15  the county, or within the portion thereof, if any, in which an office is
   16  filled or ballot proposal is decided by the voters if the canvass of the
   17  vote  thereon devolves upon the county board of canvassers.] Such totals
   18  shall be expressed in arabic numerals.
   19    3. The board of elections shall prepare and forthwith transmit to each
   20  person determined by the canvassing board to have been elected a  certi-
   21  fied  statement,  naming  the  office to which such canvassing board has
   22  declared him OR HER elected.
   23    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04944-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to determinations by county canvassing boards
